text: Tufts Medicine is a large academic medical center in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
We were fortunate enough that we

wanted to move to one
Electronic Health Record.

So, when we thought about putting
the Electronic Health Record into the cloud,
it's not only the Electronic Health Record that goes there.

There are multiple applications
that go there, and we call it an ecosystem.

So when we talk about data, when we
talk about information, it's all in one place.

Based on that, we were looking for companies that would
help us to do compute power efficiently, quickly, and faster.
And we selected AWS because it was faster, as we call it, likity split.
That's very important. And they give you the guidance.
Before we went to the cloud, we had about 28 Electronic Health Records. We had 111 patient portals. 28 to 1. 111 to 1.
With the help of AWS, Epic, and other people, Tufts Medicine became the first health system in the world to go live with Epic in the cloud
What we are creating is not Electronic Health Record.
Experience for the patient, experience for the clinicians, experience for the employees, so that their workflow becomes better.
